Astronomy is the study of celestial objects, space, and the physical universe as a whole. It encompasses various subfields, including astrophysics, planetary science, and cosmology. By analyzing data from space-based observatories and ground-based telescopes, astronomers seek to understand the behavior and properties of celestial objects, from stars and galaxies to black holes and the cosmic microwave background radiation.
